meta.script:
{ "@context": "http://schema.org" ,"@type": "NewsArticle" ,"mainEntityOfPage":{ "@type":"WebPage" ,"@id":"https://www.whec.com/coronavirus/rcsd-expanding-food-distribution-sites-at-schools-next-week/5702289/" } ,"headline": "RCSD expanding food distribution sites at schools next week" ,"image": {"@type": "ImageObject" ,"caption": "RCSD expanding food distribution sites at schools next week" ,"author": "News10NBC" ,"url": "https://www.whec.com/whecimages/repository/2020-03/City_county_officials_announce_food_options_for_Rochester_families_amid_coronavirus_concerns-syndImport-053306.jpg" ,"width": ,"height": } ,"datePublished": "2020-04-16T12:52:22-04:00" ,"dateModified": "2020-04-16T13:02:24-04:00" ,"author": { "@type": "Person" ,"name": "Jenn Brink" } ,"publisher": { "@type": "Organization" ,"name": "WHEC" ,"logo": { "@type": "ImageObject" ,"url": "https://www.whec.com/whecimages/favicons/android-chrome-144x144.png" ,"width": 144 ,"height": 144 } } ,"description": "The Rochester City School District is increasing the number of locations offering food to families and students during the COVID-19 pandemic. " ,"articleBody": "

ROCHESTER, N.Y. (WHEC) — The Rochester City School District is increasing the number of locations offering food to families and students during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Beginning Monday, April 20, meals will be available at four additional sites throughout the city.

Grab-and-go meals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner will be available at the following locations from 8 a.m. until 2:30 p.m., Monday through Friday:

- Douglass Campus, 940 Fernwood Park
- Mary McLeod Bethune School No. 45, 1445 Clifford Avenue
- Roberto Clemente School No. 8, 1180 St. Paul Street
- Enrico Fermi School No. 17, 158 Orchard Street

The following RCSD schools will continue to serve as meal distribution sites from 8 a.m. until 2:30 p.m., Monday through Friday:

- East Upper and Lower School, 1801 E. Main Street
- Dr. Freddie Thomas Campus, 625 Scio Street
- RIA/Jefferson High School Campus, 1 Edgerton Park
- James Monroe High School, 164 Alexander Street
- John Williams School No. 5, 555 Plymouth Avenue
- Virgil I. Grissom School No. 7, 31 Bryan Street
- Wilson Foundation Academy, 200 Genesee Street
- Abelard Reynolds School No. 42, 3330 Lake Avenue

Meals will continue to be served at the following R-Centers, from 8 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., Monday through Friday:

- Adams Street, 85 Adams Street
- Ave D, 200 Avenue D
- Carter Street, 500 Carter Street
- Tyshaun Cauldwell, 524 Campbell Street
- Frederick Douglass, 990 South Avenue
- Flint Street, 271 Flint Street
- David Gantt, 700 North Street
- Trenton and Pamela Jackson (Clinton-Baden), 485 N. Clinton Avenue
- Thomas Ryan, 530 Webster Avenue

According to district officials, the RCSD has distributed 81,379 breakfast meals and 98,842 lunch meals in four weeks. Dinners continue to be provided by Foodlink.

" ,"articleSection": ["Headlines","Health"] }

div.h1: RCSD expanding food distribution sites at schools next week

img.alt: RCSD expanding food distribution sites at schools next week

div.p: ROCHESTER, N.Y. (WHEC) — The Rochester City School District is increasing the number of locations offering food to families and students during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Beginning Monday, April 20, meals will be available at four additional sites throughout the city.
Grab-and-go meals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner will be available at the following locations from 8 a.m. until 2:30 p.m., Monday through Friday:

- Douglass Campus, 940 Fernwood Park
- Mary McLeod Bethune School No. 45, 1445 Clifford Avenue
- Roberto Clemente School No. 8, 1180 St. Paul Street
- Enrico Fermi School No. 17, 158 Orchard Street
The following RCSD schools will continue to serve as meal distribution sites from 8 a.m. until 2:30 p.m., Monday through Friday:

- East Upper and Lower School, 1801 E. Main Street
- Dr. Freddie Thomas Campus, 625 Scio Street
- RIA/Jefferson High School Campus, 1 Edgerton Park
- James Monroe High School, 164 Alexander Street
- John Williams School No. 5, 555 Plymouth Avenue
- Virgil I. Grissom School No. 7, 31 Bryan Street
- Wilson Foundation Academy, 200 Genesee Street
- Abelard Reynolds School No. 42, 3330 Lake Avenue
Meals will continue to be served at the following R-Centers, from 8 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., Monday through Friday:

- Adams Street, 85 Adams Street
- Ave D, 200 Avenue D
- Carter Street, 500 Carter Street
- Tyshaun Cauldwell, 524 Campbell Street
- Frederick Douglass, 990 South Avenue
- Flint Street, 271 Flint Street
- David Gantt, 700 North Street
- Trenton and Pamela Jackson (Clinton-Baden), 485 N. Clinton Avenue
- Thomas Ryan, 530 Webster Avenue
According to district officials, the RCSD has distributed 81,379 breakfast meals and 98,842 lunch meals in four weeks. Dinners continue to be provided by Foodlink.
